newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Phase One of Turkmenistan refinery gets financing.
newsitem.headline: Phase One of Turkmenistan refinery gets financing.

text.p: Israel's Merhav Group announced the signing of $165 million in financial contracts for Phase One of the upgrading and modernisation programme for the Turkmenbashi Refinery in Turkmenistan.
Merhav was contracted by the Turkmenistan government to structure the project, arrange financing and oversee implementation of the $500 million, three-phase programme.

Phase I, awarded to Mannesman/KTI, is being financed by Deutsche Bank AG with coverage from the German credit agency Hermes. It involves the erection of a new lube oil complex with capacity for 80,000 tonnes a year.
Merhav said in a statement that financial contracts for the second and third phases totalling $330 million will be signed by the end of September and the end of December, respectively.

Merhav is active in several of the Commonwealth of Independent States in the areas of oil and gas, trading, project finance and agriculture. It is also co-developing the $1.3 billion Egyptian-Israeli refinery in Alexandria.
